item.title: Should Brazil be considered a cyber security threat?
item.description: Cybercriminals frequently target major events like the Olympics to spread malware, and the 2016 Rio Games were no exception. While it’s crucial to stay vigilant against phishing attempts that exploit current events, a report from Fortinet, “FortiGuard Eye of the Storm,” highlights why the 2016 Olympics warranted particular concern. Although cyberattacks at the Olympics are not a recent phenomenon, with incidents dating back to the 2004 Athens Games, Fortinet raised concerns about the Rio Games for two key reasons that could impact attendees and have a ripple effect on those back home:

item.title: SingPost honors Team Singapore's accomplishments in Rio
item.description: Source: SingPost. Singapore Post, or SingPost, is releasing two limited-edition stamp sheets on August 29, 2016, to honor Team Singapore’s performance at the 2016 Rio Olympics. This project is a collaboration with the Singapore National Olympic Council, and all profits, with a minimum of S$10,000, will be donated to the Singapore Olympic Foundation. This includes Singapore’s first-ever Olympic gold medal. One sheet, the limited edition “Team Singapore MyStamp” sheet, costs S$20, with a face value of S$6.

item.title: Singapore emerges victorious at the Culinary Olympics 2016
item.description: Source: the Singapore National Culinary Team. The Singapore National Culinary Team outperformed over 30 countries to become the champions of the Culinary Olympics 2016. The team achieved gold medals in both the Cold Display and Hot Cooking categories, proving the country’s chefs are world-class. From left: Teo Yeow Siang, team captain, from Lavish Catering; Triston Fang, team member, from Ocean Restaurant by Cat Cora, Resorts World Sentosa; Alan Wong, team member, from Lavish Catering; team manager Louis Tay from Swissotel Merchant Court; Roy Lim, team member, from Unilever FoodSolutions; and Alex Chong, team member, from The Regent Singapore.

item.title: Instagram outperformed Facebook during the Rio 2016 Olympics
item.description: Source: ComScore. Social network interactions between Facebook and Instagram for July 2016 around the Olympic games, which ran from 5 to 21 August. ComScore, a media measurement company, found that Instagram was the top platform for engagement during the 2016 Rio Olympics, even though Facebook, its parent company, was primarily used for pre-event official content sharing.
